text: Tulio Febres-Cordero Troconis Tulio Antonio Febres-Cordero Troconis (May 31, 1860 June 3, 1938) was a Venezuelan writer, historian, university professor and journalist. As a topographer, he developed the technique imagotipia (1885), or art to represent images with typefaces. He taught "Universal History" at the University of the Andes and made a fundamental contribution to the intellectual culture of Venezuela, by studying the history of Mérida. ==References== Category:1869 births Category:1938 deaths Category:People from Mérida, Mérida Category:Topographers Category:University of the Andes (Venezuela) faculty Category:Venezuelan academics Category:Venezuelan historians Category:Venezuelan journalists Category:Venezuelan male writers
title: Tulio Febres Cordero
